content.description: This climb follows an arete up and over a flat sloping face. Although this problem is perhaps the easiest to get to, it is not known to be one people come back for, due to it's repetitive move set.
content.location: Found close to the road at the very start of the "house Side" area.

content.description: The best rock at crumble crag (acknowledging the obvious low bar) this boulder starts to the left of the sloping start rail of Arrowhead on a right hand incut edge and the left hand on a juggy undercling. Make a dynamic move to the slot higher up the vein and top out same as arrowhead. This variation starts slightly to the left and skips the holds out right but is roughly the same difficulty just bigger more powerful moves.
content.location: On the same boulder as Arrowhead

content.description: The first move, from the sit star over to the first cluster of holds on the right side may be the crux move on the problem for most. From the right side cluster of holds the reach back to the middle can be a little tricky, but the hand hold you reach for is great. From there, you make your way up, and finish off with a good set of holds.
content.location: The rock looks triangular with a white quarts filled area going vertically up the middle. From the road walk around the right side past a few short cliffs until you see the boulder, the house is visible from this boulder.

content.description: The right side of the area has a few boulder problems. Most are of low quality or in the Veasy or V0 range with one particularly worth while boulder.
